trustfund: TF029688-PHRD-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF033634-LATVIA - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT LOAN,TF033606-LATVIA - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            assessed as satisfactory. The key lessons learned are: 1)
            Ambitious but realistic reform targets can be important
            stimulus to action. Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) targets
            were established that challenged the Government to act
            boldly across a broad front. The lesson is that the setting
            of less ambiguous targets, even if they might have had a
            greater likelihood of attainment, would probably have
            resulted in less progress in the end. 2) A participatory
            approach can help the Government achieve consensus among its
            own bodies. This involved major changes to strengthen
            capacity for the management of public finances, as well as
            development of a framework and associated action plan for
            the reform of the public sector, although further action is
            needed for the latter. 3) Setting realistic objectives and
            working out their major elements with key civil servants in
            transition economies such as Latvia can motivate the
            professionals in the Government and can stimulate changes in
            the way officials think about economic policy. 4) Public
            sector reform is a delicate process which requires clear
            vision, careful planning, and a schedule for implementation
            over a number of years. It also requires strong leadership
            from the top as such reform concerns every ministry and
            agency in the Government.
